intro: Orchis rectiflorus, commonly known as the early purple orchid, is a species of orchid native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It typically grows in moist, calcareous soils in woodlands and grasslands. The plant features a tall, unbranched stem that can reach up to 1 meter in height. Its flowers are clustered in a spike, with purple petals and a distinctive yellow-green lip. Orchis rectiflorus blooms from April to June, making it one of the earliest flowering orchids of the year.
